item.title: Michael Jackson: On the Wall – the glorification of a glorified man
item.author: Febi Sidiku,
item.description: Stepping into the National Portrait Gallery felt like visiting a world-famous show: there were long queues of people for tickets, Michael Jackson’s vibrant music was playing with dancing audiences, and visitors spanned all races, ages, and genders. Even before entering the exhibition, there was a …

item.title: Tacita Dean’s LANDSCAPES: Self exploration, fate, nostalgia, and lots of thinking
item.author: Febi Sidiku,
item.description: LANDSCAPES is the 3rd of Tacita Dean’s series of exhibitions, with PORTRAIT and STILL LIFE being displayed in other galleries in London, broadcasting the artist’s wide range of talents. By reminding the viewer that the places you go are often linked to something personal, LANDSCAPES creates an …
